SENT.plain: To assess the efficacy, tolerability and safety of Levetiracetam (LEV) therapy, we identified 21 (15 male; 6 female) patients with a history of benign epilepsy with centrotemporal spikes (BECTS), with and without secondarily generalization in children and adolescents aged between 5.0 and 12.1 years
LEV was administered as a first drug (number of patients=9) or converted after previous treatment with other AEDs (number of patients=12)
The patients were subdivided into two groups: "newly diagnosed" patients and "converted" patients
Patients were followed up for 12 months and all patients were able to continue on LEV treatment
At the end of follow-up (12 months), all patients were seizure free or showed a reduction of seizures >50%
Overall, 100% of patients completed the 12 months study, without any important side effect
Somnolence and irritability occurred in two (9.5%) patients
Our results support findings that LEV monotherapy is effective and well tolerated in children with BECTS
Prospective, large, long-term double-blind studies are needed to confirm these findings
